meanings.definition: To make someone or something famous or remembered forever.
meanings.sent1: The hero's bravery was immortalised in the history books.
meanings.sent2: The artist's masterpiece immortalised her in the art world.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's hilarious performance was immortalised in everyone's memory.
meanings.sent4: Her words were immortalised in the hearts of all who heard them.
meanings.sent5: The victory was immortalised in the minds of the spectators.

meanings.definition: To preserve the memory of someone or something for a long time.
meanings.sent1: The old photograph immortalised the happy family moment.
meanings.sent2: The monument immortalised the sacrifice of the soldiers.
meanings.sent3: The recipe immortalised the taste of grandma's cooking.
meanings.sent4: The love letter immortalised their feelings for each other.
meanings.sent5: The inscription on the tombstone immortalised his legacy.
